title: Riot, Fiora's Visual makes no sense.
body:
How did you even get to where you did on Fiora? Was it the influence from that new horrifying fizz skin?
(http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nCwaLnCv-rM/Va7GwORX2TI/AAAAAAAAFIQ/UYUQs3QjjWo/s1600/fiora1compare.jpg)
Just look at it. Does this look like an upgrade to you? Her model looks like an old guy in drag. She's not graceful and she has a bunch of fluff on her clothes. This was definitely not the skin I bought. Why is everything so oversized and flamboyant?  

Is this where the hideous old Miss Fortune model went? Into Fiora? I don't understand how you did so well on Miss Fortune's model/Captain Fortune's art only to come up with this for Fiora. Is this some thinly veiled attempt to just piss over Fiora fans some more? Wtf?  How did your team's art direction take such a ridiculous turn? It wasn't just the splash art, but the model too.  Honestly, I'm not even sure why you decided to fuck with Fiora's visuals. She didn't need it. 

And I'm not even going to go into details on how a duelist is now a support bruiser. It wasn't even that bad until I got to the ult. Oh, and I love how she still has mana costs with those CDs. 

It's a little hard to be constructive, because there's ...nothing to change other than to go back. You started well on the skills and then just... 8 second window to hit 4 places to get an AoE heal.. Right. Good luck getting that before you get blown up/CCed or they escape. And again, her visuals DID NOT need to change. I'm usually excited to see Riot's new visual updates and splash art because they're usually good, but I can't believe this is what you came up with for Fiora?  I already know you guys won't change anything based on your player's opinions once it hits PBE, but still. Ugh.

It is the reason I stopped buying skins. If I liked one, it could get changed for any reason.

To be fair, I totally understand Riot's change of stance. If what they say is true (it does sound plausible) and a wast majority (don't remember, but I'm pretty sure it was over 95%) of refunds were issued to people with almost no recent playtime on the champion; people who obviously were just trying to get a free refund on a champion they no longer play, it's understandable that they stopped doing that. Their support already takes a lot of time to answer tickets... doesn't seem sensible to increase that time further, merely to deal with people who want to exploit Riot's refund policy.

Edit: Just as it's understandable that people with legitimate concerns are upset about this change of policy.
Well the question is this: Did people stop playing a champion because s/he wasn't fun? If that is the case, then they SHOULD be able to use a refund to get another champion.

Should they? There are ways to test out a champion before buying it. Riot is not responsible for peoples' bad decisions. And they are definitely not responsible for people doing basically the same bad decision four times; seeing as how everybody gets 3 refunds anyway.

I'm also not really sure whether I like that change of their policy (luckily I never needed it), hence why I only pointed out it's an understandable decision. But as for whether somebody deserves a refund because he stopped playing a non-fun champion, my opinion is very clear. Test out champions before you buy them or live with the consequences of being impatient.
As a sidenote: I never really understood why people would buy champions with RP anyway; and likewise I don't get why people would want a refund for IP that badly.

I agree, the free week thing is wonderful. And I get the idea of not using the refund as a test on a new skin/champion. But if you really enjoy Eve before her rework, and then stopped playing her after it because you didn't like what happened to it shouldn't you be able to refund it? But not with a hard cap of 90 days you can't refund old champions/skins.

It's not about how much older or prettier she looks in the new splash art. It's about the amount of detail that went into it. It's more realistic, and therefore more consistent with Riot's most recent Champions in terms of artistic style.
